decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of efficient and low-cost Elf creatures. The deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and utilize cards like Timberwatch Elf and Wildheart Invoker to buff up the team for a lethal attack. The deck also includes cards like Essence Warden and Wellwisher to gain life and sustain the aggressive strategy. With a mix of creature ramp and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost, evasive creatures and countermagic to disrupt opponents while maintaining pressure on them. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence with creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ninja of the Deep Hours, backed up by Spellstutter Sprite for additional disruption. The deck also runs a suite of efficient cantrips like Ponder and Preordain to help find key cards. In addition, it utilizes cards like Snap and Spire Golem to tempo opponents and protect its own threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using removal spells and disruption to keep the opponent's board in check. It also utilizes the powerful enchantment Pestilence to clear the board of small creatures. The deck includes various card draw spells to ensure a consistent stream of resources and keeps the opponent on the back foot. The deck also includes lifegain and artifact ramp to stabilize against aggressive strategies. Overall, the deck aims to grind out value and outlast the opponent in a long game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through repetitive casting of powerful spells like Mulldrifter and Archaeomancer, while utilizing the synergy between Sunscape Familiar and various cantrips to generate card advantage. The deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent by recurring cards with Ghostly Flicker and Snap, and utilizing reanimation spells like Reaping the Graves. The mana base is designed to enable consistent color fixing and ramp through enchantments like Fertile Ground and Utopia Sprawl. Mystic Teachings provides toolbox options for finding key spells.

This deck is focused on putting a lot of pressure on the opponent by quickly playing low-cost, efficient creatures with abilities that allow for aggressive plays and strong synergies. The deck aims to control the board by overwhelming the opponent with threats while also maintaining a steady stream of damage and creature presence. The inclusion of pump spells and equipment helps to further increase the damage output and resilience of the creatures, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and turn the game around.

This deck focuses on putting out cheap artifacts to power up creatures like Atog and Auriok Sunchaser to deliver fast and aggressive damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Of One Mind and Thoughtcast to draw more cards, the deck can maintain its tempo and overwhelm the opponent quickly. With a mix of protection spells like Dispel and removal spells like Galvanic Blast, the deck aims to control the board and push through damage efficiently. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure smooth and consistent plays throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Elf creatures to generate mana quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. The key strategy involves playing multiple Elves that tap for mana, such as Priest of Titania and Birchlore Rangers, to cast spells like Timberwatch Elf and Lys Alana Huntmaster to pump up the team. Lead the Stampede and Distant Melody help refill the hand with more Elves, while abilities like Vivien's Grizzly and Viridian Longbow provide additional utility and removal options. Wellwisher offers a way to gain life to stay in the game longer against aggressive opponents.

This deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly by playing multiple Sliver creatures with abilities that enhance each other. By utilizing cards like Muscle Sliver and Predatory Sliver, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful creatures. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help to refill the hand with more creatures, while the mana base provides the necessary colors to cast the Slivers efficiently. The deck is designed to be aggressive and resilient, constantly pressuring the opponent to keep up with the onslaught of Slivers.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of creature recursion, card draw, and countermagic. Creatures like Archaeomancer and Mulldrifter can be brought back from the graveyard to reuse their abilities, while God-Pharaoh's Faithful and Sunscape Familiar help gain life and reduce the cost of spells. The deck also includes a few flicker effects like Ephemerate and Ghostly Flicker to generate value from entering the battlefield triggers. The goal is to out-value the opponent and ultimately overwhelm them with card advantage and resilient threats.

This UB Delver deck focuses on fast and efficient creature and spell control, utilizing cheap removal spells like Snuff Out and Agony Warp to maintain board presence. Counterspells and card draw options like Brainstorm and Preordain provide additional control and consistency. Delver of Secrets and Augur of Bolas offer early aggression and card advantage, setting the pace for the game. The inclusion of Thorn of the Black Rose provides a powerful card advantage engine, ensuring the deck can maintain pressure and out-value opponents in the late game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw while using cards that gain life to help stabilize against aggressive decks. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by recycling key spells with Mystic Teachings and Devious Cover-Up, while also having access to strong removal options like Chainer's Edict and Agony Warp. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through efficient spells and resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a strong, aggressive board presence by attaching powerful aura cards to creatures like Slippery Bogle and Silhana Ledgewalker. These auras enhance the creatures' abilities and stats, creating a formidable threat for the opponent. With cards like Rancor, Ethereal Armor, Armadillo Cloak, and Ancestral Mask, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient attacks while maintaining card advantage through cards like Utopia Sprawl and Abundant Growth. The deck also includes some removal and creature search to adapt to different game situations.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through cheap and efficient spells like Chain Lightning, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt. By playing aggressive creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner and Thermo-Alchemist, along with burn spells and direct damage, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of Curse of the Pierced Heart ensures a steady stream of damage, while cards like Fireblast provide a powerful finisher. With a fast pace and plenty of burn, this deck aims to win the game swiftly.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using efficient removal spells and lifegain tools to outlast opponents. The strategy involves establishing a board presence with Guardian of the Guildpact and gaining card advantage with cards like Night's Whisper. The key combo of Pestilence and Pristine Talisman allows for repeated damage to all creatures on the board while gaining life to survive longer. The key is to disrupt opponents' strategies and grind out a win through attrition.

The Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. This deck utilizes low-cost creatures like Thraben Inspector and Seeker of the Way alongside powerful combat tricks such as Prismatic Strands to apply pressure early on. With a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Journey to Nowhere, as well as card draw from cards like Faithless Looting, the deck can maintain its aggressive pace while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a token generation theme with cards like Battle Screech to go wide and close out games quickly.

The deck revolves around using defenders and mana ramp creatures to generate a lot of mana quickly. The goal is to combo off by creating infinite mana with Axebane Guardian and Freed from the Real, then win the game by casting Bloodrite Invoker or Valakut Invoker. The deck also utilizes recursion with Mnemonic Wall and Pulse of Murasa to protect its combo pieces and keep the engine running smoothly. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help to dig for combo pieces and maintain card advantage, while Saruli Caretaker and Quirion Ranger provide additional mana acceleration.
